title: Online Education Program for Managing Mental Disorders in Primary Care

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational medical knowledge and comprehension of mental health terminology
context.additional_context: Interactive educational environment using real-time video conferencing tools, targeting higher education graduates or medical field job seekers

learning_goals: Identify symptoms and diagnostic criteria of major mental disorders (e.g., depression, anxiety disorders) commonly encountered in primary care settings with 80% accuracy
Achieve 90% proficiency in applying initial assessment protocols for mental health issues to analyze patient cases

Learners select three evidence-based diabetes management treatment guidelines from an online Learning Management System (LMS), apply them to two given clinical scenarios, develop treatment plans with at least 80% accuracy, and submit a report meeting at least four out of five formative assessment checklist items
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
